EXPRESS MAIL STEAMERS ALEXANDRIA, PORT SAID, AND SUEZ, Naples, Marseilles, GENOA, SOUTHAMPTON, ANTWERP, BREMEN, HAMBURG,. AMERICA, EASTERN ASIA, AUSTRALIA Etc. For Particulars see Advertisement below. Peninsular and Oriental S. N. Company. Summer Rates will be targeted from 2 May to 31 October. For the convenience of families and others,a large portion of each ship’s accommodation has been reserved for Egypt, so that Berths can be definitely engaged at once, as if the voyage were commencing at Port Said. Plans can be seen at the Offices of the Company s Agents The through Steamers for Marseilles and London are intended to leave Port 8atd after the arrival of the 11 a.m. train from Cairo, every Monday until June, and then every Tuesday. A steam tender will meet the train to convey passengers to the ship. Express steamers leave Alexandria overy Wednesday at 4 p.m. for PIR2EU8, SMYRNA, MITYLENK, and CONSTANTINOPLE, in connection with Orient Express train-de-luxe for Vienna, Paris, and London. PALESTINE - SYRIA UNE.

Past steamers leave Alexandria every Saturday at 6 p.m., and Port Said every Sunday at 6 p.m., for JAFFA (for Jerusalem), CAIFFA (for Narareth), BEYROUT (for Damascus), TRIPOLI, ALEXANDRETTA, MESSINA, continuing in alternate weoks to LARNACA and LIMASSOL (Cyprus). RED SEA UNE. Steamers leave Suez fortnightly on Wednesday at 6 p.m. for JEDDAH, SUAKIN, MASSO- WAH, HODEIDAH, and ADEN ; and in the intervening weeks for PORT SUDAN and SUAKIM direot. Calls will be made at TOR (for Mount Sinai) as required. N.B.—Deok chairs provided for the use of passengers, excellent ooisine and table wine free. Steamer plans may be seen and passages booked at the Company’s Agencies at Alexandria, Cairo, Port Said, and Suez, or at Thos. Cook & Son or other Tourist Agenoy. 31-12-904
